reference.title: Terraform Variables
reference.shortdesc: You can configure the following values in your tfvars file using the overrides.tfvars.sample file included with as a guide.

desc.note: All values are required. Except for dea_count, specify all variable values in quotation marks. These values are case-sensitive.

row.entry: The initial username for your cluster
The initial password for your cluster
The number of Droplet Execition Agent (DEA) hosts that you want to create
The DNS server of your local environment, 8.8.8.8 by defaultIf your local environment does not have a DNS server, remove this variable.
The address of your HTTP proxy
The address of your HTTPS proxy
The location and name of the private key pem file associated with your key pair, relative to the tfvars file.For convenience, you can place the two files into the same directory.
The IP addresses that do not use a proxy
The unique regional location on which the deployment is launched, nova by default
The ID of your Ubuntu 14.04.3 cloud image
4 (larger or equals to 8 GB) by default
3 (larger or equals to 4 GB) by default
The name of your key pair.

example.title: A sample .tfvars file
example.codeblock:
openstack_base_image_id = " "
openstack_flavor_id.core = "4" openstack_flavor_id.dea = "3"
openstack_availability_zone = "nova" openstack_keypair = "myKeyPair" openstack_network_id = "123a1ab1-12a1-123a-1a12-a1234a123a12"" openstack_network_name = "myNetwork" openstack_floating_ip_pool = "ext-net" dns_server = "203.0.113.0" key_file = "myKeyFile.pem"
cluster_admin_username = "myClusterUsername" cluster_admin_password = "myClusterPassword123"
dea_count = 1
http_proxy = "http://myproxy.example.com/" https_proxy = "https://myproxy.example.com/"
no_proxy = "198.51.100.0/24"
